title: Final test
postscript: You can go back and re-read any of these chapters whenever you want – keep your Swift skills fresh!
question: Which of these statements are true?
hint: These questions are taken from a variety of chapters – you might need to re-read one of them if you're not sure about an answer.
correct: Closures can capture values around them.
Structs are copied differently from classes.
Variadic functions take any number of parameters.
Throwing functions must be called using try.
wrong: Functions inside structs are called closures.
Swift automatically generates the shorthand parameter names #0, #1, and so on.
Classes may not contain private methods.
You can make a new struct by inheriting from any other structs that are not declared using final.
Extensions can only be used on protocols.
